decks.notes: This deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's game plan while applying pressure with efficient creatures. By combining disruptive spells like Thoughtseize and Fatal Push with blink effects from cards like Ephemerate and Flickerwisp, the deck aims to control the board and disrupt the opponent's strategy. Cards like Phelia, Exuberant Shepherd and Overlord of the Balemurk provide powerful threats that can quickly close out the game. The deck also utilizes a selection of lands to fix mana and protect against aggressive strategies.

This Dimir Control deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's plans through a combination of counterspells, removal spells, and hand disruption. The deck aims to control the board and the opponent's hand while slowly building its own resources and card advantage. It utilizes a mix of instant-speed interaction and threats like Murktide Regent to put pressure on the opponent while maintaining control of the game. The mana base is built to support the deck's color requirements and enable efficient casting of its spells.

Utilizing a combination of spells, artifacts, and powerful creatures to create a landless combo strategy that aims to quickly assemble a win condition, such as Goblin Charbelcher, and overwhelm the opponent before they can establish their own game plan. The deck focuses on manipulating resources and disrupting the opponent's strategy while setting up its own game-winning combo. The goal is to be proactive and aggressive in executing the combo, while also maintaining control over the game through counterspells and disruptive cards.

The main concept of this deck is to apply pressure on the opponent with aggressive creatures while disrupting their game plan with removal spells and hand disruption. The deck also aims to control the board through flickering creatures like Flickerwisp and Solitude. The mana base includes a variety of fetch lands to ensure consistent mana fixing. Overall, the deck focuses on tempo and disrupting the opponent's strategy to gain advantage and win the game efficiently.

The deck focuses on aggressive plays by utilizing a combination of powerful creatures and efficient spells to quickly overwhelm the opponent. It aims to establish an early board presence with cards like Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer and Territorial Kavu, while also disrupting the opponent's game plan with cards like Leyline of the Guildpact and Leyline Binding. The inclusion of Fable of the Mirror-Breaker and Scion of Draco allows for explosive turns and potential game-ending plays. The deck also includes some control elements like Stubborn Denial and Consign to Memory to protect its threats and deal with opposing threats.

The main focus of this Boros Aggro deck is to quickly overwhelm the opponent with aggressive creatures and powerful spells. The deck includes a mix of low-cost creatures like Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer and Guide of Souls, as well as removal spells like Dismember and Thraben Charm to deal with opposing threats. Additionally, the inclusion of cards like Arena of Glory and Ajani, Nacatl Pariah provide additional support and buffs to the deck's creatures, allowing for quick and decisive victories. The deck aims to apply steady pressure and maintain control of the battlefield to secure a win.

This Mardu Aggro deck focuses on quickly overwhelming the opponent with aggressive creatures and burn spells. The key strategy is to establish a fast board presence using creatures like Guide of Souls and Ocelot Pride, while disrupting the opponent with cards like Thoughtseize and Fatal Push. The deck also includes powerful finishers like Ajani, Nacatl Pariah and Phelia, Exuberant Shepherd to close out the game quickly. Overall, the deck aims to apply pressure early and maintain control of the board to secure victory.

The control deck focuses on utilizing a variety of counterspells, removal spells, card draw, and powerful planeswalkers like Teferi to dominate the game. It aims to disrupt the opponent's strategy, control the board, and eventually win through card advantage and high-impact threats. The deck's strategy revolves around managing resources efficiently, protecting its threats, and staying one step ahead of the opponent to ultimately secure victory.

This Ruby Storm deck focuses on quickly generating mana with rituals and medallions to cast a flurry of spells, aiming to draw through the deck with Glimpse the Impossible and Reckless Impulse. Ral, Monsoon Mage is crucial for dealing damage and generating mana, while Past in Flames allows for recursion of spells from the graveyard. Wrenn's Resolve helps protect key pieces, while cards like Artist's Talent and Wish offer additional flexibility and options for winning the game. Overall, the deck aims to chain together spells and generate a lethal storm count to overwhelm the opponent.

This deck focuses on aggressive play with a mix of creatures and spells to quickly deal damage to the opponent. The key strategy is to control the board early with efficient creatures like Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer and Wild Nacatl, while maintaining pressure with burn spells like Lightning Bolt. Leyline of the Guildpact provides additional support for multicolor creatures, while Tribal Flames can finish off the opponent or take out key threats. The inclusion of cards like Stubborn Denial and Leyline Binding helps to protect your creatures and disrupt the opponent's game plan.

This deck focuses on using ramp spells like Birthing Ritual and Coiling Oracle to quickly get ahead on mana and cast powerful spells like Shardless Agent and Ice-Fang Coatl. It also includes disruptive spells like Force of Negation and Endurance to disrupt opponents' strategies. The deck aims to overwhelm opponents with a mix of creatures, counterspells, and removal spells, while also maintaining card advantage with cards like Subtlety and Boseiju, Who Endures. Overall, the deck looks to apply early pressure and control the game through tempo and card advantage.

The main concept of this deck is to control and manipulate the opponent's plays through a combination of counterspells, discard spells, removal, and card advantage. By disrupting the opponent's game plan with Thoughtseize and counterspells like Counterspell and Force of Negation, while also utilizing removal like Fatal Push and Psychic Frog, the deck aims to maintain control of the game. The inclusion of card draw and recursion through Thought Scour, Unearth, and Ketramose, the New Dawn helps ensure the deck's ability to maintain resources and out-value the opponent in the long run.

This deck focuses on using the UrzaTron lands to quickly ramp into powerful Eldrazi creatures and spells, using control elements to disrupt the opponent's game plan. The key strategy is to assemble the UrzaTron lands to generate a large amount of mana, allowing for explosive plays with Eldrazi creatures like Thought-Knot Seer and Ulamog, the Ceaseless Hunger. The deck also includes control elements like Karn, the Great Creator and Ugin, the Eye of the Storms to disrupt the opponent's board state and prevent them from executing their game plan effectively.

The deck focuses on ramping up mana quickly to play powerful Eldrazi creatures like Emrakul, the Promised End. It also controls the board with cards like Kozilek's Command and Malevolent Rumble, while generating tokens with Sowing Mycospawn and Nulldrifter. The deck includes various mana ramp cards like Utopia Sprawl and Eldrazi Temple to get ahead of opponents. Writhing Chrysalis serves as a removal option, while cards like Kozilek's Return and Ugin's Labyrinth help control the battlefield. The deck aims to overwhelm opponents with powerful Eldrazi creatures and control options.

The deck focuses on ramping up mana quickly with lands like Gruul Turf and Simic Growth Chamber, while also utilizing Amulet of Vigor to untap lands for even more mana acceleration. The goal is to quickly assemble the combo of Primeval Titan and lands like Crumbling Vestige or Lotus Field to generate an overwhelming amount of mana and search for powerful lands like Vesuva or Urza's Saga. This allows for explosive plays like casting Scapeshift to search for multiple lands and win the game in a single turn.

The deck is focused on slowing down the opponent and controlling the game using cards like Ensnaring Bridge, Lantern of Insight, and Pithing Needle. It also utilizes disruption and hand control with cards like Inquisition of Kozilek and Thoughtseize. The deck aims to disrupt the opponent's strategy while setting up its own win conditions through cards like The Meathook Massacre and Codex Shredder. It also utilizes mana disruption with cards like Blood Moon and takes advantage of synergies between artifacts with cards like Urza's Saga and Mox Opal.
